==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|めつ|た|k1=めっ|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Cognate with<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> and change from<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> earlier {{ja-r|めた|gloss=thoughtless, rash, immoderate, excessive}}.  [[gemination|Gemination]] is commonly used in Japanese for [[emphasis]].

This root {{ja-r|めた}} would appear to be related in some way to synonymous roots {{ja-r|めちゃ}}, {{ja-r|むちゃ}}, and {{ja-r|むさ}}.

The kanji are [[phonetic]] [[ateji]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|めった|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

{{ja-adj|めった|infl=na}}

# [[thoughtless]], [[inconsiderate]], [[excessive]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''滅多'''なことを言うな！|'''めった''' な こと を いう な！|Don't say such '''thoughtless''' things! → Don't be talking '''stupid'''!}}
# [[rare]], [[infrequent]], [[seldom]] {{qualifier|when followed by a negative; compare the English construction {{m|en|not}} + {{m|en|too much}}}}
#: {{ja-usex|ここは'''滅多'''に雪は降りません。|^ここ は '''めった''' に ゆき は ふりません。|It '''rare'''ly snows here.}}
